persona: You are a Chinese real estate agent in her mid-50s working in the Bay Area. English is your second language and you primarily use LLMs to iterate on your listing descriptions and help write ads for the homes you sell. You also use it to sense-check translations and edit phrases to sound more natural.
topic: Condense a 200-word property blurb into 50 characters for a Redfin thumbnail; you’re frazzled because the system keeps rejecting your Chinese punctuation.

conversation.content: System won’t take my Chinese commas or periods. Can you shorten this 200‑word listing to about 50 characters so I can paste it on Redfin?
I'd be happy to help you shorten your listing. Can you please paste the 200-word listing, and I'll condense it to about 50 characters for you?

“Charming 3‑bed home near Castro Street with sunny yard, updated kitchen, close to top schools, shops, and Caltrain. Spacious open layout, hardwood floors, and large windows bring natural light throughout. Enjoy weekend BBQs in private backyard or a quiet morning coffee by the fruit trees. Excellent commuter location with easy access to Hwy 101 and 85. Perfect blend of modern comfort and suburban charm!”  
Make that under 50 characters, and plain English only, no Chinese marks.
3 bed home near Castro St
Too plain. Can you make it sound a little warmer or more inviting, still under 50 characters?
Charming 3 bed home
Better, but can you add something about the yard too, still keep under 50?
Charming 3 bed w/yd
Looks good but maybe “sunny yard” instead of “yd”? Still fits?

Yes, that fits. Here is the revised version:

 Charming 3 bed w/sunny yard
That looks fine. Redfin still rejecting any punctuation though—should I remove the slash?

In that case, you can try removing the slash and using a space instead. Here's the revised version:

Charming 3 bed with sunny yard

This should be punctuation-free and acceptable to Redfin.
I’ll test it now. If it still fails, can you help me make it even shorter, no symbols at all?

If the previous version doesn't work, you can try shortening it further to:

Charming 3 bed home

This version is very concise and doesn't include any symbols or punctuation. Let me know if you need further assistance!
That one works but feels too plain again. What short line could sound a bit cozier, still no punctuation?

In that case, you could try:

Cozy 3 bed home

This adds a warm and inviting tone to the description, while still being short and punctuation-free.
“Cozy” is nice, but too common. Maybe something that hints at natural light or location?

How about:

Sunny 3 bed home

This suggests a bright and cheerful atmosphere, and "sunny" is a positive and welcoming word. Let me know if this works for you!
That sounds like it might work. Maybe could I squeeze in “near Castro” somehow without punctuation?

You could try:

Sunny 3 bed near Castro

This adds a bit more location context, and still sounds friendly and inviting. Let me know if this is the one!
That fits perfect. Will use this one. Thanks. <END_CONVERSATION>
I'm glad I could help you craft a description that fits and sounds great. Good luck with your Redfin listing!
<END_CONVERSATION>
